doc.title: FileSystemFileEntry
doc.sidebarHTML:
1. File and Directory Entries API
  2. FileSystemFileEntry
  3. Instance methods
    1. createWriter() Non-standard Deprecated
    2. file()
  4. Inheritance
    1. FileSystemEntry
  5. Related pages for File and Directory Entries API
    1. FileSystem
    2. FileSystemDirectoryEntry
    3. FileSystemDirectoryReader
    4. FileSystemEntry

value.content: The FileSystemFileEntry interface of the File and Directory Entries API represents a file in a file system. It offers properties describing the file's attributes, as well as the file() method, which creates a File object that can be used to read the file.

value.title: Instance properties
value.content: Inherits the properties of its parent interface, FileSystemEntry, but has no properties unique to this interface.

value.title: Instance methods
value.content:
createWriter() Deprecated Non-standard

Returns a FileWriter object which can be used to write data into the file represented by the directory entry.

file()

Creates a new File object which can be used to read the file.

value.title: See also
value.content:
• File and Directory Entries API
  • Introduction to the File and Directory Entries API

doc.summary: The FileSystemFileEntry interface of the File and Directory Entries API represents a file in a file system. It offers properties describing the file's attributes, as well as the file() method, which creates a File object that can be used to read the file.
